_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:00:56 using v2.2
title: How has the proportion of cancelled operations changed?
analysis_commentary: While the number of cancelled operations has been rising steadily over time, so too has the amount of elective acitivity performed by the NHS. Cancelled operations as a proportion of all elective admissions have been falling for some time, reaching 0.9% in 2013/14. By comparision, this measure stood at 1.1% in 1994/95 and was at its highest at 1.5% in 2001/02. It is still clear that the proportion of cancelled operations rises notably in quarter 4 of each year.
